You can attach a few files for test decryption by packing them into an archive with zip, rar, tar, 7zip, 7z, tar.gz extensions of no more than 10 megabytes using the attach button directly in the chat.

If your archive weighs more than 10 megabytes, please use our file sharing service.

For security reasons we do not click on other links you send in chat.
Please wait for a reply, sometimes it takes several hours due to possible time zone differences.

and upload here

this is not the first case, the decryptor can decrypt everything if you pay
pay and get decryptor

Since we have several ESXI machines, one of them seems normal, but the number of virtual machines on that one is not large. Moreover, we have a NAS with a lot of office documents that we want to decrypt. Considering the current situation, I would like to communicate sincerely with you. You take the money, and we will try to minimize the loss of some data. Is that okay
Brother, I'm very sincere and hope to reach an agreement with you. However, I hope we both need to make some concessions. Please communicate this matter with your boss and solve our problem
I understand the situation is difficult for you
yes ，my friend

It's better than losing everything, so I try my best to communicate with my boss about this matter

I know what you need is money, but what we need is to lose as few virtual machines or files as possible

we have a reputation, we have been working for more than 6 years and after pay the decryptor we have not had any problems with their decryption
we are not a scam, we work honestly

Our boss has arranged for me to minimize the losses as much as possible. If the decryption cannot be done correctly, we will either replenish the data or create a new virtual machine. However, for those with normal suffixes, we want to decrypt them.
So, I would like to sincerely discuss with you whether a reasonable price can be set again. I don't want to be fired by the boss
We will ignore those damaged virtual machine files and try our best to recover some losses. Could you please help us，I'm also a poor wage earner

Because many of our files are damaged and I know he can't decrypt them, I beg you to reset a reasonable price. I will report to the boss again and try my best to meet your demands to reach an agreement

We have three esxi systems. Two of them have garbled file suffixes. The samples have also been sent to you. Indeed, their decryption cannot proceed normally. However, there is still one esxi whose suffix is normal. We want to decrypt it. If the price is too high, our boss will ask me to leave. So I would like to request you to reset a reasonable price. Regarding our current special circumstances,
Brother, please reply to me as soon as possible. I hope we can reach an agreement today, solve this matter, forget those bad things. You take the money and we can recover some losses

Moreover, for those virtual machine files with abnormal suffixes after encryption, we have retrieved the files from the VMDK disk through data recovery methods. Their underlying layer is only encrypted for approximately 700MB. Therefore, we can retrieve the data from those virtual machine disk files with abnormal encryption. However, this cannot start our original system and can only be reinstalled. So what I want to say is that this has brought us a lot of troubles.

There are three situations where the suffix is incorrect. 1: The file itself is not encrypted. We can directly delete the suffix and the file can be used, or change it to the correct suffix and decrypt it without affecting its use. 2: When the encryption of a file is correct, we need to change its abnormal suffix to a normal one to decrypt it correctly. After the file is decrypted, it is normal. 3: If the file encryption process stops and the file is damaged, and we change it to a normal suffix,
 it will not be decrypted either, because the file itself is not fully encrypted and its encrypted information is incomplete, so it will not be decrypted

Most of our data is still damaged. Of course, this is just an objective response. The real situation is that a small amount of VMDK has been decrypted. Just as I said before, I'm not lying. I'm just giving you suggestions to update your encryption.
